pages.text: The Heat Exchanger serves 2 purposes: to act as a heat sync and to provide a way of generating heat (or decreasing temperature below ambient). The Heat Exchanger has a heat loss of 10째C/t. Also, a Heat Exchanger can perform certain "recipes" with blocks directly below it.

Some conversions produce heat while the Heat Exchanger is below a certain temperature, while others consume heat while the Heat Exchanger is above a certain temperature. $(br2)It is worth noting that these "recipes" will function regardless if the liquid below is a full source.

The purpose of these "recipes" isn't the blocks created, but the temperature change. The temperature change is not immediate, but is applied over time at 25째C/t until the full temperature change has been applied. This means that a Heat Exchanger, kept supplied with certain blocks directly below it, is a constant 25째C/t source or cooler.

pages.title: Insulated Exchanger
pages.text: There is also an Insulated Heat Exchanger, which functions indentically to a normal Heat Exchanger except it does not have a passive heat loss of 10째C/t (making it ideal for doing conversions but useless as a heat sync).
